page.title: 12Old Aerodrome, Tockwith 2
page.content: Farmers are buying back the land that was compulsorily purchased by the Ministry of Defence in wartime. Driving School Centre. This includes the wartime control tower and most of the remaining runway. The control tower is used as an office to co-ordinate the following activities: 1.Driver Training Centre for heavy goods vehicles - buses, lorries. People have come from the Shetland Islands to use this facility. 2.Driving School for car drivers. 3.Skid control circuits - motorists learn to control their vehicles on a slippery road surface. 4.Demonstrations of vehicles. Other wartime buildings are occupied by small businesses eg car repairs, scrap merchants, pheasant rearing. Part of the aerodrome was used to build the 250 houses of the new estate
